fields.summary: Error creating Alloy app from Studio if alloy and CLI are installed without restarting

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install Studio, download updates, install SDKs, install dependences (including Node.js).

Create template application using either 'Default Alloy Project' or 'Two-tabbed Alloy Application' and neither can be created due to a path problem with the template assets.

Same problem for two-tabbed template.

h3. Actual Result
'/usr/local/lib/node_module/Default Alloy Project' does not exist.

h3. Expected Result
/usr/local/lib/node_module/default does.
fields.summary: Default Alloy Projects Cannot Be Created on OSX

comments.body:
Hello,

I tested this issue with Ti SDK 3.2.0.GA, Alloy 1.3.0 and Titanium Studio, build: 3.3.0.201401091816. I cant reproduce this issue. Please update to latest Titanium Studio and SDK and try again. For latest version Ti SDK Please visit http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2014/01/3-2-1-beta-of-sdkstudio-now-available/
 
Thanks

Few questions:

1. Is this problem limited to Alloy projects or do you run into the same issue with Classic project?
2. Did you install Studio, SDK and other dependencies in default directories? If not, what directories did you choose?
3. Does this problem occur with project names with space or with any project?
4. Please attach the output of the following command: titanium info
This is a duplicate of TISTUD-5981. The workaround is to restart Studio and then create the Alloy project. The issue is fixed in Studio 3.2.1.
